ratings.question_text: Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.
comments: we submitted video recordings of performed piano pieces

narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I learned how to read and play figured bass, harmonize existing melodies, create my own melodies based on chords, play jazz chords, do simple score-reading, and read alto clef. I also learned music theory surrounding each of those topics.

The course gave me tools to realize figured bass, read multiple-parts score, think about accompaniment patterns. My functional keyboard skills improved. Everything still needs to be developed, but the course gave me a way to start. I am very grateful for the course.
I learned SO much about music theory and harmonization, as well as developed the ability to write and improvise melodies

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: The professor and TA are really understanding of people's skill level on the keyboard, so I was able to improve at my own rate. This course is also a rare opportunity to apply music theory in practical situations, which is really fun. Can't really think of any weaknesses.
The materials of the course were great! Unfortunately, there were not enough weeks to cover everything the teacher had planned to cover.

I really appreciated the varied types of assignments, the submission method (by recording a video), and the one-on-one feedback provided by the professor and TA! I think it would be helpful to have more handouts/written notes for reference (since a lot of the topics discussed are theory-based, and pretty abstract)

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: The class had frequent one-on-one zoom sessions, which were really great. People are hesitant to ask questions in class, so the one-on-ones made it easier to work out issues.
I don't really understand this question.
The methods of submitting assignments worked well! The one-on-one zoom meetings for instruction and feedback also helped!

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Absolutely! And don't worry if you don't have experience on the keyboard, the assignments are definitely doable as long as you know where the notes are on a keyboard. This class is especially good for COVID times, I wouldn't have been involved with playing music this semester if it wasn't for this class. This is also a good class to take with MUSI 210, skills you learn in one class will help in the other.
Yes, if you have any understanding of music and are looking for a humanity credit; also if you would like to learn more about music, great learning environment

I definitiely would, if that student has a preexisting interest in music theory! I think I gained a lot of practical experience and knowledge from this course, and I can already see the improvements in my musicianship!
